did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: DeWitt Historical Society of Tompkins County, Ithaca, N.Y. publications, 1947-1977.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: DeWitt Historical Society of Tompkins County.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Pamphlets and clippings relating to people, events, and local landmarks in Tompkins County and surrounding region.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets and clippings relating to people, events, and local landmarks in Tompkins County and surrounding region.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: DeWitt Historical Society of Tompkins County.

did.unittitle: Contents

p.extref: The printed guide and box list is available by clicking here. PDF

did.unittitle: Over My Shoulder. Genieva B. Pauling. A Backward look at life in a Steuben County rural community before the twentieth century's changes. Ithaca, 1969
Diary of Abner H. Thomas. Notes. Town of Ulysses, Tompkins County, New York, 1963-1865. Transcribed by his daughter, Eva Thomas, 1948. New York, 1960
Early Kitchens. Ruth B. Kane. New York, 1966
The Ballad of Bertie. From His Journal, by Barbara Bell. (2 copies; 1 copy has 55 verses, and the other one has 57 verses). New York, 1966
Carrie Manning's Diary, 1869. Edited by William Heidt, Jr. Adapted for Junior Historians by Curtis Pfaff, Head of Citizenship Education Department, Ithaca High School. New York, 1956
Pioneer Hunters and Their Game. Edited by William Heidt, Jr. New York, 1960
Jeffrey Ferris Family Genealogy. Floyd I. Ferris. New York, 1963
The Early Years of Leland Stanford. New Yorker Who Built the Central Pacific Railroad, by Dr. Norman E. Tutorow. (2 copies) New York, 1969
Tom Quick, Early American. Frederick W. Crumb. New York revised 1969
A Sentimental Journey, 1968. W. Glenn Norris, Tompkins County Historian. New York, 1968
Ruloff: The Great Criminal and Philologist. DeWitt Historical Society of Tompkins County. New York, 1906 . Pub. #1
A History of the Railroads in Tompkins County. Hardy Campbell Lee. Pub. #4, DeWitt Hist. Soc. of Tompkins County. New York, 1947 (2 copies)
From A Local Historian's Notebook. Collected by Hazel M. Shear, formerly Allegheny County Historian. New York, 1969
Brigham Young in Cayuga County. Mary Van Sickle Wait. New York, 1964
Addie Smiley's Letters from the West, 1882-1886. Edited by William Heidt, Jr. The original letters are on the archives of the DeWitt Hist. Soc. New York, 1955

The Pioneer Clevelands. Edited by William Heidt, Jr. From the Journal of Adaline Cleveland Hosner and the family records preserved by her granddaughter, Mrs. Jessie Agard. New York, 1956 (See Acc. #6005)
The Origin of Place Names in Topkins County. W. Glenn Norris, Tompkins County Historian, Tompkins County Clerk. Publication #6 of the DeWitt Hist. Soc. of Tompkins County. New York, 1951
Early Explorers and Travelers in Tompkins County. W. Glenn Norris, Tompkins County Historian. New York, 1961

Forests and Farms in Caroline. Compiled from various historical sources by William Heidt, Jr., with an introduction by W. Glenn Norris, descendent of Caroline pioneers, Tompkins County Historian. New York, 1965
Remembering Ithaca, 1930-1970. Jessamine Kelsey Johnson. New York, 1971
Simeon DeWitt Founder of Ithaca. William Heidt, Jr.; Carol K. Kammen, Editor. New York, 1968
Simeon DeWitt and Miliatry Tract Township Names. Albert Hazen Wright. New York, 1961
The Godfather of the Christen'd West: Who Was He?. George P. Philes. New York, 1961
In the Wake of the Horton.Roy C. Shurger. The story of the Col. J.H. Horton as told to his wife, Delena. New York, 1969
The Old Courthouse. William Heidt, Jr. New York, 1968
The Blue-Eyed Lassie and the Rewick's in Ithaca. William Heidt, Jr., Ithaca City Historian. New York, 1970
Henry Walton: An Early Artist Historical Settings of Ithaca Paintings. Leigh Rehner, Adapted from John G. Brooks' 1942 Manuscript. New York, 1969 (2 titles on pamphlet)
West Hill and Some of Its Historic Homes and Families. Elizabeth Genung, Robert Flinn and William Heidt, Jr., New York, 1964
The Enduring Clinton House: An Account of Its Life and Times. Elizabeth B. Rogers. New York, 1970
Beyond the Footlights Story of Dryden Opera House, 1893-1946. Samuel A. Cloyes, Curator, DeWitt Hist. Soc. New York, 1968
The Healer. The Story of Dr. Samantha S. Nivison and Dryden Springs, 1820-1915. Samuel A. Cloyes
The Old Cemetary of Dryden Tompkins County, New York, Records of Inscriptions and Geneological Notes. Complied by Charles M. Sandwick, Sr., New York, 1966 , revised 1970
Some Spenser History. Floyd I. Ferris. New York, 1958
The West Danby Baptist Church 1810-1963. Gerald P. Holmes. New York, 1963
Danby Historical Sketches. Tresa Cotright, Town Historian. New York, 1968
A Romance Come to Dandy. William Heidt, Jr., Studies in Tompkins County History #1. New York, 1967
It Happened in Lansing. Isabelle H. Parish, 1964
This, Too, Happened in Lansing. Isabelle H. Parish, Town Historian. New York, 1967
Echoes of Lansing Yesteryears. Jennie H. Conlon. New York, 1970
More Bits and Pieces of Lansingville History. Nellie Tucker Minturn, 1971
Kingdom Farm and Gilead School. Adapted by William Heidt, Jr. City Historian, New York, 1971
Silently They Stand. Jennie H. Conlon. New York, 1966
O-We-Nah and Other Indian Stories. Adapted by William Heidt, Jr., New York, 1962
O-We-Nah: A Legend of Lake Eldridge and 16 Other Iroquois Indian Legends. Adapted by WIlliam Heidt, Jr., New York, 1971
The Story of Count Frontenac and the Iroquois, 1672-1700. Mary Van Sickle and William Heidt, Jr. New York, 1970
The Cayuga Indian Reservation and Colonel John Harris. John Van Sickle. New York, 1965 (2 copies)
The Logans and Other Iroquois Accounts. Mary Van Sickle Wait, with Doris Sutherland and William Heidt, Jr., contributors. New York, 1968
Old Indian Trails in Tompkins County. W. Glenn Norris. New York, 1944 and 1969 (2 copies)
The Leni-Lenapes Became Delawares and Citizens. William Heidt, Jr., New York, 1971
The Catskill Turnpike: A Wilderness Path. Almyra H. Morgan. New York, 1971
Book of Records. For the Richford Branch of the Freewill Baptist Church in Dryden, N.Y.. H.R. Neff, copied by Carol Willsey Bell, 1970
In Memoriam. Benton Sullivan Monroe, 1873-1969 ; W. Glenn Norris, 1895-1969 ; Ralph Claude Smith, 1892-1970
California Ho! By Sail Boat and Mule Train, 1849. Adapted by William Heidt, Jr., Tompkins County Historian, 1972
For Whom the Wine Was Poured and Other Poems. Edith Horton, 1971 , 47 pp.
A Child in the Nineties. Edith Horton, 1971 ; 30 pp.
Early Boyhood Days in Ithaca. Lawrence H. Jacobs, 1971 ; 67 pp.
The Honorable Jacob Willsey's Journal, 1831-1860. Copied by Carol Willsey Bell
The Evray Quadruplets, Born 1855. Barbara Bell, (Location Connecticut Hill)
